course.title: From Postwar to Postwall German Cinema
course.description: The New German Cinema would become internationally prominent during the 1970s. This class will focus on exemplars of the movement and also important films that preceded and followed it, features by Staudte, Fassbinder, Herzog, Kluge, Schlondorff, von Trotta, Wenders, Dorrie, Tykwer, and Petzold. What meanings do these works (both as single entries and as functions of a collective national ensemble) have for us today? No previous course work in film studies is required or presumed.
